alert.note: Alert for Assumption; Lower Terrebonne; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Upper Lafourche; Upper Terrebonne (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 01 at 10:51PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN ST. JOHN THE BAPTIST, SOUTHERN ST. JAMES, NORTHWESTERN TERREBONNE, NORTHWESTERN LAFOURCHE AND SOUTHEASTERN ASSUMPTION PARISHES THROUGH 1115 PM CST... At 1049 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Supreme to 6 miles southwest of Schriever to 12 miles south of Amelia. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Houma, Thibodaux, Schriever, Gray, South Vacherie, North Vacherie, Supreme, Raceland, Chackbay, Labadieville, Bayou Cane, Mathews, and Edgard. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for southeastern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: Assumption; Lower Terrebonne; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Upper Lafourche; Upper Terrebonne
